```{r}
#| message: false
#| warning: false
library(tidyverse)
library(primer.data)

x <- ces |> 
filter(year == 2020) |> 
select(approval, education, ideology) |> 
drop_na() |> 
slice_sample(n = 2000)
x
```

```{r}
x |>
  ggplot(aes(x = ideology, fill = approval)) +
  geom_bar() + labs(
  x = "Political Ideology",
  y = "Count",
  title = "Relationship Between President Approval and Political Ideology",
  subtitle = "Most people strongly dissaprove.", 
  caption = "Data from CES")
```

The president is one of the most important people in the U.S. Using data from the 2020 CES, one of the largest political surveys in the U.S., we want to find how presidential approval is affected by different ideological groups.
